rev.comment: humans were a product of nature last I knew..
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:Necromouse12hd.jpg|thumb|225px|right|Necrophilia, although commonly thought to be only done by humans, does in fact also occur in nature.]]
+
[[Image:Necromouse12hd.jpg|thumb|225px|right|Necrophilia, although commonly thought to be only done by humans, does in fact also occur amongst other species.]]
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to nonresponsive persons, including the [[coma]]tose and [[corpse]]s. Necrophilia is a primary motive behind the use of incapacitating chemicals (such as [[GHB]]) to commit date [[rape]]. The most [[sensationalism | sensationalized]] form of necrophilia is when it involves sex with the [[death | dead]], and in colloquial use "necrophilia" normally involves the dead.
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to nonresponsive persons, including the [[coma]]tose and [[corpse]]s. Necrophilia is a primary motive behind the use of incapacitating chemicals (such as [[GHB]]) to commit date [[rape]]. The most [[sensationalism | sensationalized]] form of necrophilia is when it involves sex with the [[death | dead]], and in colloquial use "necrophilia" normally involves the dead.
Line 7: Line 7:
In some cases, necrophiliacs work in the [[funeral]] business, presumably for the facile access to [[human]] corpses.
In some cases, necrophiliacs work in the [[funeral]] business, presumably for the facile access to [[human]] corpses.
â  
== Consensuality issue ==
== Consensuality issue ==
â  
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead person. Virtually all human [[society | societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead person. Virtually all human [[society | societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
== Necrophilia in the arts ==
== Necrophilia in the arts ==
â  
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism | romantic]] connections between [[romantic love | love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western]] [[art]]istic expression. The [[William Shakespeare | Shakespeare]] [[tragedy]] ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]'' ends with the young lovers united in death. [[Edgar Allen Poe]] once described the death of a beautiful young woman to be one of the most [[beauty | beautiful]] images. (By this, he was not saying that it is a good thing for young women to die; to him [[melancholy]] and pain were sources of beauty.) Many [[alternative rock]] artists also focus on the connection between romantic love and death, despair, and the occult; in [[Europe]], the most notable example is [[HIM (band) | Him]], and more generally the artists of the [[love metal]] movement. A comparable [[United States | American]] analogue might be [[Stabbing Westward]], a [[gothic rock]] band whose songs dealt with [[despair]], [[drug abuse]], [[sexual abuse]], [[death]], and [[romantic love]], often in conjunction.
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism | romantic]] connections between [[romantic love | love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western]] [[art]]istic expression. The [[William Shakespeare | Shakespeare]] [[tragedy]] ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]'' ends with the young lovers united in death. [[Edgar Allen Poe]] once described the death of a beautiful young woman to be one of the most [[beauty | beautiful]] images. (By this, he was not saying that it is a good thing for young women to die; to him [[melancholy]] and pain were sources of beauty.) Many [[alternative rock]] artists also focus on the connection between romantic love and death, despair, and the occult; in [[Europe]], the most notable example is [[HIM (band) | Him]], and more generally the artists of the [[love metal]] movement. A comparable [[United States | American]] analogue might be [[Stabbing Westward]], a [[gothic rock]] band whose songs dealt with [[despair]], [[drug abuse]], [[sexual abuse]], [[death]], and [[romantic love]], often in conjunction.
